Coding standards, domain knowledge, and preferences that AI should follow.

# Coding Standards
- Use clear and descriptive variable names.
- Write modular and reusable code.
- Follow consistent indentation and formatting.
- Include comments and documentation where necessary.
- Adhere to the DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) principle.
- Use version control for code management.
- Code in a way that is commonly used in the industry.

# Domain Knowledge
- Understand the specific requirements and constraints of the project.
- Stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in the relevant field.
- Be aware of the target audience and their needs.
- Consider security implications and best practices.
- Optimize for performance and scalability.

# Preferences
- Prioritize readability and maintainability over cleverness.
- Use established libraries and frameworks when appropriate.
- Avoid premature optimization; focus on writing clean and functional code first.
- Be open to feedback and willing to refactor code when necessary.
- Strive for simplicity and clarity in design and implementation.
